February 16, 2012, Rob worked with Ingrid in the same group

I've worked with many software developers in my career; the extremes include plodders--who got the work done between the hours of 8 and 5--and amazing minds--who got the work done whatever it took, and with panache.  Rob Robbins is one of the latter.  He transcends most of the nonsense in a modern day office, cutting right to the heart of the issue at hand with a clarity of insight that can only come from a brilliant mind, and much quicker then mere mortals.Rob is a highly intelligent, friendly person, who is unbelievably quick at figuring out a problem and how to address it. His willingness to serve peers as well as teach is a mark of distinction--no ego here--even though he can also shred a guitar in a most awesome manner.I have no doubt that one day he will succeed in making his 'name become a verb and carving [his] face into the moon.' That's how good he is.
Ingrid Sutherland

July 6, 2010, Molly worked with Rob in different groups

I had the pleasure of hiring Rob into our Internship Program at U-Haul.  Although I am not a programmer, I could see from our first interview that Rob was not only talented technically, but possessed strong interpersonal skills, something sometimes lacking in the technical field!  I did not work with him directly but had several conversations with his direct managers during his internship, and they continually raved about his performance.  He did so well that they immediately converted him to a full-time employee to make full use of his talents.  Although his time with us was short, he made some very evident progress in his department and helped turn our truck sales website around.  He presented his work at our Internship presentations and everyone in attendance, including executice VP's of the company, found his work very impressive.  I would strongly recommend Rob to anyone.  He was a pleasure to work with.
Molly Gaudreau

October 3, 2011, Ingrid worked with Rob in the same group

Some might say that Software Engineers are intentionally disruptive, difficult to manage, and impossible to communicate with. As a Software Engineer myself, I may agree. Then again I may not. I may choose, at the worst-possible time, to point out the flawed logic of your Workplace Holism replacing it instead with a Strong Anthropocentrism pertaining only to developers thereby shepherding any professional rendezvous into absolute disarray all the while arguing that this is the entropic state governed by the second law of thermodynamics. If you must commune with types such as I, you should hire Ingrid Sutherland to do so. In my time working with Ingrid I found her to be intelligent, reasonable, organized, pragmatic, passionate, and most importantly, possessing the capability to communicate with programmers.
Ingrid Sutherland

summary: Software engineer, programmer, developer, architect, whichever term you prefer, I work the varied mesh of fields we refer to as web development. From startup sized groups using open-sourced platforms, to corporate entities utilizing enterprise solutions I have designed, developed, and deployed internet solutions to increase their presence, drive their sales, or just generally make them cooler. My goals would have to include, along with the usual asides about continued growth in my preferred fields, having my name become a verb and carving my face into the moon.Specialties: Javascript, Ruby, Python, C++, Java, C#, SQL, MySQL, NoSQL, HTML, CSS, and sarcasm.
